data.name: ksChartTemplateWarning
data.value: This discourse analysis tool has columns preset for SVO languages. If you need to change that order, edit the list called "Text Constituent Chart Templates". The columns are the 3rd level list items. Note that once you have charted some text, you cannot reorder the columns without first clearing the chart.

data.name: ksCreatingCustomGramCategory
data.value: You will now be taken to a new, custom grammatical category. Enter at least the name and abbreviation for the new category. Then, click the "Back" button on the toolbar to return to where you were working. The new category will then be available for you to choose.

data.name: ksCreatingCustomLexRefType
data.value: You will now be taken to a new lexical reference type. Enter at least the name and abbreviation for the type. Then, click the "Back" button on the toolbar to return to where you were working. The new type will then be available for you to choose.

data.name: ksError
data.comment: caption for message box

data.name: ksInformation
data.comment: caption for message box

data.name: ksInitializingMessageDialogs_
data.comment: message for splash screen

data.name: ksLoading_
data.comment: message for splash screen

data.name: ksShowingSemanticClassification
data.value: This view shows semantic domains that have been used to classify senses, each listing the related senses. You can optionally show all semantic domains, even those that have not been used for any senses.

data.name: kstidOpenSampleDbMsg
data.value:
Do you want to study the training materials for Language Explorer?
If you click Yes, the Sena 3 sample project will open. On the Help menu, point to Training and click Student Manual for a walk-through guide. Alternatively, point to Demo Movies and choose an option. - Play All gives a half-hour overview of Language Explorer. - You may also choose specific demo movie topics.
If you click No, you will see various options for starting work in Language Explorer.
data.comment: note the embedded newlines in this message.

data.name: kstidSupportEmail
data.comment: Email address for sending bug reports to

data.name: ksUsedForSemanticBasedEntry
data.value: This tool is designed for a typist to use during a semantically-based word-collection workshop. For information on this method, see http://www.rapidwords.net and http://www.sil.org/computing/ddp/.

data.name: chooseTextsToDisplayAndUse
data.value: Choose texts to display and use.

data.name: ksAdvancedDlgMenuItem
data.comment: Subitem in Mark as Post/Preposed from...

data.name: ksAdvDlgMainPostText
data.value: Select the row and column to mark this cell's content as postposed from.

data.name: ksAdvDlgMainPreText
data.value: Select the row and column to mark this cell's content as preposed from.

data.name: ksAdvDlgPartialPost
data.value: Select the words to be marked as postposed.

data.name: ksAdvDlgPartialPre
data.value: Select the words to be marked as preposed.

data.name: ksAdvDlgPreposeCaption
data.comment: AdvDlg = AdvancedDialog

data.name: ksBackMenuItem
data.comment: Submenu of ksMoveMenuItem or ksMoveWordMenuItem

data.name: ksChooseDifferentColumn
data.value: Please choose a different column to insert this displaced word(s)
data.comment: When user chose wrong column for Chart Orphan (temporary?)

data.name: ksDelRowWarning
data.value: This will delete {0} rows of data from your chart! Are you sure?
data.comment: Dialog warning. Responses are Yes/No.

data.name: ksExportErrorMsg
data.value: An error occurred while exporting your data. This is probably a bug in the FieldWorks code. Details: {0}

data.name: ksForwardMenuItem
data.comment: Submenu of ksMoveMenuItem or ksMoveWordMenuItem

data.name: ksFoundAndFixingInvalidDataCells
data.value:
The program has detected invalid data (cells out of order or not in any column) within this chart. This can be caused by deleting or re-ordering columns in the template.
The program will attempt to repair the links within the data. You may need to do additional editing, or you may prefer to start over if the resulting chart is too different from what you expect.

data.name: ksMakeDepClauseMenuItem
data.value: Make a Dependent Clause out of
data.comment: Menu item that appears in empty cell in chart.

data.name: ksMakeSongClauseMenuItem
data.value: Make a Song Clause out of

data.name: ksMakeSpeechClauseMenuItem
data.value: Make a Speech Clause out of

data.name: ksMarkMenuItemFormat
data.comment: Used to format top-level marker menu items, e.g., "Mark TenseAspectMood".

data.name: ksMergeAfterMenuItem
data.comment: Causes this cell to merge with empty cell to right to save space

data.name: ksMergeBeforeMenuItem
data.comment: Causes this cell to merge with empty cell to left to save space

data.name: ksMissingMarker
data.comment: Marker for missing items.

data.name: ksMovedTextAfter
data.comment: Marker inserted to indicate a moved object to the right of the marker.

data.name: ksMovedTextBefore
data.comment: Marker inserted to indicate a moved object to the left of the marker.

data.name: ksMoveHereToolTip
data.value: Insert selected text into the {0} column.

data.name: ksMoveMenuItem
data.comment: Combines with submenus forward/back/ eventually up/down

data.name: ksMoveWordMenuItem
data.comment: Combines with submenu Forward/Backward, maybe enentually up/down

data.name: ksNextNClausesMenuItem
data.comment: {0} is a small integer (3-9 at most, probably)

data.name: ksNoColumns
data.value: Your discourse chart template is missing or has no columns. You can fix this by adding some in Lists/Text constituent chart templates.
data.comment: Warning message that appears when the text chart is displayed and there are no columns in the template.

data.name: ksNotesColumnHeader
data.comment: Appears as header of the final, Notes column.

data.name: ksNoWordformsMsg
data.value: No wordforms are selected to move
data.comment: Used when a Move button is pressed in the Constituent chart and nothing is selected.

data.name: ksOnlyOneTemplateAllowed
data.value: The text charting mechanism can only handle one template at this point. Only the first template will be used.
data.comment: Warning message that appears when the text chart is displayed and there are more than one template defined.

data.name: ksOtherMenuItem
data.comment: Subitem in Make dependent clause of...

data.name: ksPostposeFromMenuItem
data.comment: Mark the current cell as moved from a cell that comes BEFORE it.

data.name: ksPreposeFromMenuItem
data.comment: Mark the current cell as moved from a cell that comes AFTER it.

data.name: ksRedoMoveWordToColumn
data.comment: Part of the Redo item

data.name: ksRowEndsParaMenuItem
data.comment: Check mark item in row menu.

data.name: ksRowEndsSentMenuItem
data.comment: Check mark item in row menu.

data.name: ksTextEditWarning
data.value: The underlying text for this chart appears to have changed. The program has attempted to repair things, but you may just need to start over.

data.name: ksUndoMoveWordToColumn
data.comment: Part of the Undo menu item

data.name: ksWarning
data.comment: Used as dialog box caption

data.name: FLExBridgeListener_UndoExport_Error_exporting_LIFT
data.value: Error exporting LIFT data; could not complete Send/Receive
data.comment: Message displayed if an error occurred during "Send/Receive Lexicon" while the export of the LIFT data was going on.

data.name: FLExBridgeListener_UndoExport_LIFT_Export_failed_Title
data.comment: Title of message box displayed if an error occurred during the Send/Receive lift while the export of the LIFT data was going on.

data.name: GoldEticGuidFixer_GuidsChangedContent
data.value: Some GUIDs for Parts of Speech that did not match the GOLD standard were found and replaced.
data.comment: Message box content for when the utility found GUIDs and changed them.

data.name: GoldEticGuidFixer_Guids_changed_Title
data.comment: MessageBox title when the utility looking for incorrect Part of Speech GUIDs found some.

data.name: GoldEticGuidFixer_Label
data.value: Use standard Part of Speech GUIDs
data.comment: Label shown in the Tools:Utilities dialog for the POS GUID utility.

data.name: GoldEticGuidFixer_NoChangeContent
data.comment: Message box content for when the POS GUID utility found nothing to change.

data.name: GoldEticGuidFixer_NoChangeTitle
data.comment: MessageBox title when the utility looking for incorrect Part of Speech GUIDs found nothing.

data.name: kBasicImportFailureMessage
data.value: FLEx was not able to do the initial import. FLEx Bridge will protect its shared LIFT data from loss by requiring a retry of the initial import, until it is successful. Retry attempts will start with the next LIFT Send/Receive attempt. Sorry for the inconvenience, but a new version of FLEx will likely be required in order to continue using LIFT Send/Receive.

data.name: kCannotDoGetAndMergeAgain
data.value: Second Get and Merge not possible

data.name: kFlexStandardImportFailureMessage
data.value: FLEx was not able to import the changes received. FLEx Bridge will protect its shared LIFT data from loss by requiring a retry of the import, until it is successful. Retry attempts will start with the next LIFT Send/Receive attempt. Sorry for the inconvenience, but a new version of FLEx will likely be required in order to continue using LIFT Send/Receive.

data.name: kProblemImportWhileMerging
data.value: FieldWorks was unable to import the LIFT file {0} that resulted from merging remote changes. Remote changes have NOT been received into this project. This may indicate corruption of the LIFT file, or possibly a bug in Language Explorer. The following message may provide more details of what went wrong: {1}

data.name: kProblemMerging
data.comment: Dialog caption

data.name: kProjectAlreadyHasLiftRepo
data.value: This project has already been linked to a Lexicon (LIFT) repository. It is not possible to Get and Merge with another Lexicon repository.

data.name: ksAlwaysVisible
data.comment: menu item

data.name: ksCannotRedoConvertIrregularlyInflectedFormVariants
data.value: You cannot use 'Undo' to cancel the effect of this utility. You would need to go back to a previously saved version of the database (i.e., make a backup of your database before running this utility so you can restore to it if the results are not what you want).

data.name: ksCannotRedoConvertVariants
data.value: You cannot use 'Undo' to cancel the effect of this utility. You would need to go back to a previously saved version of the database (i.e., make a backup of your database before running this utility so you can restore to it if the results are not what you want).

data.value: Choose Complex Forms to display in Lexeme-based views

data.value: Convert variant types to irregularly inflected form variant types

data.value: Convert irregularly inflected form variant types to variant types

data.name: ksCreateLexRefType_
data.comment: menu item

data.name: ksDeleteEntriesSenses
data.value: Delete Entries and Senses that are not used in interlinear

data.name: ksDeleteEntriesSensesDoes
data.value: After a confirmation warning, this will delete all entries and senses that are not referenced in the current set of filtered interlinear texts.

data.name: ksDeleteEntriesSensesWarning
data.value: Always back up your project before using this. This will delete all of your entries and senses if you have not done any interlinearization, and can delete a large number if you have done minimal interlinearization. It cannot be undone. It will warn you about the number of entries that will be deleted and give you a chance to stop without deletions.

data.name: ksDeleteEntriesSensesWhen
data.value: Use this when you want to have a lexicon that is limited to entries and senses that are used in one or more filtered interlinear texts.

data.name: ksDeleteEntrySenseConfirmText
data.value: You are about to delete {0} lexical entries. Do you want to continue?

data.name: ksDeleteLexTree
data.value: Note: this will remove this entire {0} reference set tree.
data.comment: {0} is a line feed

data.name: ksDeleteSequenceCollectionA
data.value: Note: the listed references will still be {0} related in a
data.comment: {0} is a line feed.

data.value: Send/Receive cannot be performed when there are other applications using this project. Please close all other applications that are using this project before continuing.

data.comment: button label

data.name: ksStars
data.comment: signals missing/unknown value

data.name: ksUndoAddRevToSense
data.value: Undo Add Reversal Entry to Sense

data.name: ksUndoBulkEditRevPOS
data.value: Undo Bulk Edit Reversal Entry POS

data.name: ksUndoConvertIrregularlyInflectedFormVariants
data.value: Undo Convert variant types to irregularly inflected form variant types

data.name: ksUndoConvertVariants
data.value: Undo Convert irregularly inflected form variant types to variant types

data.name: ksUndoDeleteRevFromSense
data.value: Undo Delete Reversal Entry from Sense

data.name: ksWhatIsConvertIrregularlyInflectedFormVariants
data.value: This utility allows you to select which variant types should be converted to irregularly inflected form variant types, which are a special sub-kind of variant types.

data.name: ksWhatIsConvertVariants
data.value: This utility allows you to select which irregularly inflected form variant types should be converted to variant types (irregularly inflected form variant types are a special sub-kind of variant types).

data.name: ksWhatIsReassignHomographs
data.value: This utility cleans up the homographs numbers of lexical entries. It preserves the current relative order of homographs, so you won't lose any ordering you have done.

data.name: ksWhatIsSetPartOfSpeechGUIDsToGold
data.value: This utility will make the Part of Speech GUIDs for the project match the GOLD standard.

data.name: ksWhenToConvertIrregularlyInflectedFormVariants
data.value: Run this utility when you need to convert one or more of your existing variant types to be irregularly inflected form variant types. When a variant type is an irregularly inflected form variant type, it has extra fields such as 'Append to Gloss', 'Inflection Features', and 'Slots.'

data.name: ksWhenToConvertVariants
data.value: Run this utility when you need to convert one or more of your existing irregularly inflected form variant types to be variant types. When a variant type is an irregularly inflected form variant type, it has extra fields such as 'Append to Gloss', 'Inflection Features', and 'Slots.'

data.name: ksWhenToReassignHomographs
data.value: Run this utility when the FieldWorks project has entries with duplicate or missing homograph numbers, or when there are gaps in the homograph number sequences.

data.name: ksWhenToSetPartOfSpeechGUIDsToGold
data.value: If this project was created before FieldWorks version 8.1 and you want to use the data as part of a multi-language query, use this utility to standardize the internal identifiers (GUIDs).

data.name: ks_Add
data.comment: button label

data.name: LiftSRFailureDetectedOnStartupMessage
data.value: Your last Send/Receive Lexicon did not complete successfully. Any work you do before a successful S/R Lexicon will be lost. You should immediately retry S/R Lexicon. If it completes successfully, you can continue your work. If the S/R Lexicon continues to fail, contact flex_errors@sil.org for help before doing further work.

data.name: CannotFindToolNamed0
data.value: Could not locate the tool named '{0}'.

data.name: ksAnalysisX
data.comment: {0} is a number ("Analysis 1" for first, etc)

data.name: ksCannotMergeWordformsYet
data.value: Merging wordforms needs serious definition, before it can be done. Sorry.

data.name: ksTodo_WordformEditing
data.value: TODO: Basic wordform editing happens here.

data.name: ksListChoiceDesc
data.value: Select a feature and a value to change it to

data.name: ksWhatIsSortReversalSubentries
data.value: This utility will sort the reversal subentries in your data alphabetically.

data.name: ksWhenToSortReversalSubentries
data.value: Run this utility when you want your reversal subentries to be sorted alphabetically (in contrast to a manually chosen order, such as by frequency of use).

data.name: ksWarningSortReversalSubentries
data.value: You cannot use 'Undo' to cancel the effect of this utility. You would need to either go back to a previously saved version of the database, or manually reorder the subentries in each reversal entry again.

data.name: SortReversalSubEntries_CompletedContent
data.value: All reversal subentries are now sorted.

data.name: ksAlsoEmptyComplexFormInfo
data.value: Also removing empty Complex Form Info from {0}

data.name: ksBreakCircularRefs
data.value: Remove circular references to complex forms

data.name: ksTryIfProgramGoesPoof
data.value: Try this tool if Language Explorer disappears or produces a "FieldWorks has stopped working" dialog when you try to view the Dictionary.

data.name: ksFoundNCircularReferences
data.value: Found {0} circular references in {1} entry references

data.name: ksWhatAreCircularRefs
data.value: Older versions of Language Explorer allowed the user to make two complex form entries claim each other as components. This is no longer allowed, but older projects can be in this bad state.

data.name: SomethingWentWrongLastTime
data.value: Something went wrong the last time this program was run. Click 'Yes' to revert to 'factory settings', 'No' to see if you can preserve your settings without crashing again.

data.name: SendReceiveForTheFirstTimeContent
data.comment: HTML used to display instructions for users when the Send/Receive for the first time menu item is used

data.name: ksErrorFixerUtilityAttemptsTo
data.value: This utility attempts to fix various errors in a FieldWorks project file. The project must not be open, and must be in the fwdata (XML) format.

data.name: ksFindAndFixErrors
data.value: Find and fix errors in a FieldWorks data (XML) file.

data.name: ksUseErrorFixerWhen
data.value: Use this when a project is throwing exceptions such as "Key 62c22e20-8d8a-42bf-a54c-e21529284f2d not found in identity map...", and you suspect the data has been corrupted somehow.

data.name: ksWhatIsWriteAllObjects
data.value: This utility writes all CmObjects out fresh, as if they had all been modified.

data.name: ksWhenToWriteAllObjects
data.value: Run this whenever you want to write out all CmObjects in the system. This will fix S/R failures if basic attributes were somehow lost in the fwdata file.

data.name: ksWriteAllObjectsUndo
data.value: This operation cannot be undone, since it makes no changes.

data.name: Add_New_Analysis
data.value: images\Add New Analysis.ico;System.Drawing.Icon, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: ErrorReadingXMLFile0
data.value: There was an error while reading in the XML file: {0}.

data.name: ProblemRestoringSettings
data.value: There was a problem while trying to restore the settings. Your settings will be restored to their default values.

data.name: ksInvalidFieldInFilterOrSorter
data.value: FieldWorks has detected that an unknown field (possibly a custom field you have just deleted) is being used to filter or sort this view. Filtering and sorting will be disabled until you select a new filter or sort sequence.

data.name: ksSorting
data.comment: Label used in progress bar

data.name: LinkTargetNotAvailableDueToFilter
data.value: What would normally be shown is being blocked, probably because a filter hides it. Do you want to turn off the filter?

data.name: PunctInFieldNameWarning
data.value: The custom field name "{0}" includes punctuation characters. This may cause export to fail or make the exported file difficult for other programs to use. We recommend that you rename your custom field and then do the export again. Do you want to continue with the export?

data.name: SelectedObjectHasBeenDeleted
data.value: The selected object has been deleted (possibly by another user on a networked computer). Refreshing.

data.name: AllEntriesPublication
data.comment: Do Not Translate

data.name: BeginCompressingDataForWebonary
data.value: Compressing data before sending to Webonary.
data.comment: Displayed in the log box of UploadToWebonaryDlg when data is being zipped up.

data.name: ExportingEntriesToWebonary
data.value: Exporting entries for the {0} publication using the {1} view
data.comment: Displayed in the log box when exporting to Webonary. Arguments are: name of publication, name of configured view

data.name: ExportingEntriesToWebonaryCompleted
data.comment: Displayed in the log box when exporting to Webonary after all entries are exported.

data.name: FinishedCompressingDataForWebonary
data.comment: Displayed in the UploadToWebonaryDlg log box

data.name: ksCantJumpCaption
data.comment: Caption for any of the ksCantJump message boxes

data.name: ksCantJumpToLangProj
data.value: You are trying to follow a link to one of the root objects representing the whole project. Sorry, but FLEx does not know how to take you to a more specific place within it.
data.comment: Displayed when following a hot link, e.g., from a conflict report about a property of LangProject or LexDb (suc as one about conflicting changes to active writing systems).

data.name: ksCantJumpToObject
data.value: Sorry, FLEx does not know how to jump to this kind of object (a {0}).
data.comment: Displayed when following a hot link (e.g., from a conflict report).

data.name: ksCantJumpToScripture
data.value: Sorry, FLEx does not yet know how to jump to a particular location in Scripture.
data.comment: Displayed when following a hot link to somewhere in Scripture. Not sure this can actually happen.

data.name: ksErrorNoViewOnPublication
data.comment: Message displayed in Upload to Webonary dialog to inform user about No view was found

data.name: ksUsesTheSameConfigurationAs
data.value: {0} uses the same configuration for subfields as {1}.
data.comment: {0} and {1} are both configuration nodes

data.name: MoveDown
data.comment: action on a tree view item

data.name: MoveUp
data.comment: action on a tree view item

data.name: PublicationEntriesLabel
data.value: Clicking Submit will send {0} dictionary entries{1} to Webonary.
data.comment: Message displayed in Upload to Webonary dialog to inform user about what data will be uploaded. 0 will be a number. 1 will be either blank or a combination of ReversalEntries, ReversalEntries_Last, and ReversalEntries_Only

data.name: ReversalEntries
data.comment: Part of message displayed in Upload to Webonary dialog to inform user about what data will be uploaded. Will be inserted into the PublicationEntriesLabel string. 0 is a number. 1 is the name of a language or a reversal index configuration (view) name. This string will be used in cases where there are more than one reversal index configuration to report the count for, and this is not the last one.

data.name: ReversalEntries_Last
data.comment: Part of message displayed in Upload to Webonary dialog to inform user about what data will be uploaded. Will be inserted into the PublicationEntriesLabel string. 0 is a number. 1 is the name of a language or a reversal index configuration (view) name. This string will be used in cases where there are more than one reversal index configuration to report the count for, and this is the last one.

data.name: ReversalEntries_Only
data.comment: Part of message displayed in Upload to Webonary dialog to inform user about what data will be uploaded. Will be inserted into the PublicationEntriesLabel string. 0 is a number. 1 is the name of a language or a reversal index configuration name. This string will be used in cases where there is just one reversal index configuration to report the count for.

data.name: toApplyForWebonaryAccountExplanation
data.value: To apply for an account at Webonary, please visit {0}.
data.comment: Text at the top of the Upload to Webonary dialog. 0 will be the URL in toApplyForWebonaryAccountLink

data.name: toApplyForWebonaryAccountLink
data.comment: URL in toApplyForWebonaryAccountExplanation.

data.name: UnableToFollowLink
data.value: The application was not able to follow that link. This can happen if you have deleted the object that was pointed to by the link.

data.name: UnableToFollowLink0
data.value: The application was not able to follow that link. ({0})
data.comment: {0} is an error message

data.name: kstidMemoryDiskUsageInformation
data.comment: Label of link in the About box to open the System Monitor in Linux to show information about memory and disk usage.

data.name: kstidUnableToStart
data.comment: Error message if user clicks link in About box to open the System Monitor in Linux, but the program is not able to start, probably because it isn't installed. Program name is {0}.
